p: The chemical composition of the biochar produced from oil palm bunch is shown in ( Table 1). Palm bunch biochar contained 1.35% nitrogen, 3.02% calcium, 0.80% magnesium, 1.01% potassium, 0.12% phosphorus and 4.05 mg kg âˆ’1 of sodium. These values were generally lower than that reported for wheat and rice straw biochar [ 27]. Table 2 depicts the chemical composition of the soils used. Concentrations of phosphorus, nitrogen, organic carbon, organic matter, calcium, potassium, exchangeable acidity and effective cation exchange capacity of the control soil were higher than that of the gas flared soil.
